thread.title: Stronger for Scotland — a party slogan that reeks of frying chips
thread.title_full: Stronger for Scotland — a party slogan that reeks of frying chips

title: Stronger for Scotland — a party slogan that reeks of frying chips
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Stronger for Scotland — a party slogan that reeks of frying chips Mhairi Black described her pre-election self to the conference as “a 20-year-old chip-shop fryer” James Glossop/The Times 1 of 1 Mhairi Black described her pre-election self to the conference as “a 20-year-old chip-shop fryer” James Glossop/The Times Patrick Kidd Published at 12:01AM, October 17 2015 
Early afternoon in Aberdeen and a fug of chip oil hung over the delegates at the SNP conference. This is not, sadly, a lazy stereotype. Only a thin curtain separated the stage from a room filled with fast-food vans, and above the party slogan of “Stronger for Scotland” you could clearly make out the words “Seafresh Café”. 
Convenient, certainly, for those who wanted to slip something greasy down the gullet between speeches, but the scent   prodigy, who described her pre-election Subscribe now
